alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Knott; Lee; Magoffin; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:14AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Owsley, northwestern Knott, Breathitt, southwestern Magoffin and southeastern Lee Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 714 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chestnut Gap, or over Booneville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jetts Creek, Athol, Houston and Canyon Falls around 720 AM EDT. Guerrant, Copebranch, Turkey, Oakdale, Canoe, Sebastian`s Branch and Talbert around 725 AM EDT. Yeadon, Elkatawa, Chenowee, Gentry, War Creek, Lawson and Saldee around 730 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jackson, Inverness, Dumont, Quicksand, Curt, Haddix, Fivemile, Frozen Creek, Lost Creek, Howard Creek, Haginsville, Noctor, Portsmouth, Smith Branch, Wilstacy, Press, Keck, Flintville, Clayhole, Taulbee, Stevenson, Sikes, Rousseau, Bays, Mountain Valley, Rock Lick, Camp Lewis, Guage, Lunah, Cornelia, Puncheon, Seiltz, Dale, Lambric, Daisydell, Foraker, Hendricks, Eugene, Decoy and Fritz. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 72 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
